title: Foundation Cracks: Harmless vs Dangerous
description: Learn Foundation Cracks: Harmless vs Dangerous in one minute.

hook.text: Nearly every concrete foundation cracks. Most are harmless shrinkage. A few are warning signs of structural failure.

buildup.text: Concrete shrinks as it cures, creating hairline cracks in the first year. These are cosmetic and rarely grow wider.

discovery.text: Horizontal cracks signal lateral pressure from soil or waterâ€”the wall is being pushed inward. That's serious.

twist.text: Stair-step cracks in block foundations follow mortar joints. They signal differential settlingâ€”one side is sinking.

climax.text: A structural engineer costs $300-$500 and can save hundreds of thousands in damage by catching problems early.

punchline.text: Vertical cracks: usually fine. Horizontal: act now.

quiz.question: Which type of foundation crack indicates the most serious structural problem?
options: Horizontal cracks from lateral soil or water pressure
Vertical hairline cracks from concrete shrinkage
